title: Nat Sciver - Brunt becomes one of Britain best paid sportswomen in WPL auction
body_text:
Nat Sciver-Brunt becomes one of Britainâ€™s best paid sportswomen in WPL auction
Nat Sciver-Brunt became one of Britainâ€™s highest-paid sportswomen in Mondayâ€™s auction for the inaugural Womenâ€™s Premier League.
Mumbai Indians paid 3.2 crore rupees, or around Â£320,000, to select the all-rounder in the sister competition of the Indian Premier League while her England team-mate Sophie Ecclestone went to UP Warriorz for 1.8 crore (Â£180,000).
While prize money, such as for Emma Raducanuâ€™s 2021 US Open win, and an emerging batch of endorsement deals will present a different picture, Sciver-Bruntâ€™s windfall in particular stands out in salary terms.
She ranked behind only Indiaâ€™s star batter Smriti Mandhana in the auction prices and for less than a monthâ€™s work she will dwarf her England earnings.
ECB central contracts are understood to be worth between Â£60,000 and Â£100,000 per year â€“ batter Sophia Dunkley was another player celebrating after being picked up by Gujarat Giants for the lower end of that range, while Alice Capsey earned Â£75,000 from the Delhi Capitals.
By way of comparison, the top price band in the ECBâ€™s domestic franchise competition the Hundred is Â£31,250 in the womenâ€™s competition. Ecclestone and Sciver-Brunt entered the WPL bidding at a base price of Â£50,000, with Sciver-Brunt benefiting from a bidding war between Mumbai and the Warriorz after early interest from Delhi. The Warriorz, led by England coach Jon Lewis, outbid the Giants for Ecclestoneâ€™s services.
Across domestic womenâ€™s sport there are very few comparable earning opportunities, with Englandâ€™s European champion footballers among the highest-profile stars. The Lionesses earn the same match fees as their male counterparts, a reported Â£2,000 per match, with central contracts starting from Â£15,000 and typically paying around Â£30,000.
Jill Scott, who retired after Englandâ€™s win, broadened her horizons outside football with a reported Â£120,000 fee for her victorious stint on reality show Iâ€™m a Celebrityâ€¦ Get Me Out Of Here! Sciver-Brunt and Ecclestone will both exceed that, and are unlikely to be locked in a cage of rats or need medics to remove cockroaches from their ears for the privilege.

Salaries in the Womenâ€™s Super League range from around Â£20,000 per year to Chelsea striker Sam Kerrâ€™s reported league-leading salary of Â£400,000.
Englandâ€™s rugby stars, who put together a world record 30-match winning run on their way to last yearâ€™s World Cup final, have central contracts reportedly worth between Â£26,000 and Â£32,000 plus match fees of Â£800. That compares poorly to New Zealand, who beat them in that final, whose players can earn up to double that upper limit plus assembly fees of up to Â£10,000 per year and plus pensions and other benefits.
Netball, a sport in which England have enjoyed huge recent success and which has a growing profile on Sky Sports, has a reported salary cap of Â£70,000. That is for a squad of 10, with two additional marquee players outside the cap.
